post.body: Who should I even follow on here???

Check out the [KickAssTorrents ZeroNet clone](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LBr1dHoXvJAMjDgW8Wcg5kbCoKyJnzo6p/). I'm skeptical a 1 to 1 clone is even possible but I appreciate the effort to at least try. Cheers!
***[PLAY](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp/) + [WebTorrent](https://github.com/feross/webtorrent) would make the ultimate ZeroNet killer app***.
If you want to link to ZeroNet using a proxy and not have to worry about the proxy going down some time in the future, use this "meta proxy": https://zero.acelewis.com
Favourites should be given priority seed status.
If ZeroNet got a [@Snowden](https://twitter.com/Snowden) endorsement it would blow the fuck up.

What are some things not allowed on the "clearnet", either through monopolistic regulation or outright censorship? I've come up with the following but could use some help coming up with a few more...

* Piracy sites that distribute warez/torrents.
* Gambling sites.
* Drug marketplaces.

I feel as though I'm missing a few themes.
In addition to "Everyone" and "Followed users", ZeroMe should have a "Trending" option that ranks posts by number of likes relative to time elapsed since posted.

Can anyone here help me get an invite to a private movie tracker? I'm a long time member of [TheVault.bz](http://thevault.bz) with a great ratio. Getting an invite for a decent tracker these days seems bloody impossible.
React and ZeroNet were made for each other!

comment.body: I think @mention notifications would be awesome.
@Sirenyc: Let users rank by number of seeds. That's my only wish at this point. :)
@Kaffie: True enough. WebTorrent adoption would probably have to happen on the clearnet first, and then propagate to ZN.
@Tkarita: Any idea why they changed up the protocol? Was there something fatally flawed with what already exists? Seems like a really bad idea to break compatibility if it can be avoided.
It's like that feeling I got when I started posting to internet bulletin boards back in the mid 90s. Freedom, wonder and this sense of infinite possibilities.
@Klaus Jónsson Zimmermann: Back in my day it took over an hour to download a single mp3 on a 56k modem. Damn kids.
@Klaus Jónsson Zimmermann: Darn. Try [contacting](https://www.reddit.com/user/_AceLewis) the dev. It may not be intentional.
@Truth: Yeah but I mean that has to happen before people put serious effort into solving the reputation problem ZN will inevitably have.
Incredible work @nofish - It's truly amazing what ZeroNet has become.
